definition: lit. to fix the tone with a single hammer blow/fig. to make the final decision
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
hammer/to hammer into shape/weight (e.g. of a steelyard or balance)/to strike with a hammer
variant of 錘|锤[chui2]
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: All of that is possible, but not a slam dunk by any stretch.
sentences.chinese: 这一切都是可能的，但不会是一锤定音。

sentences.english: It is modest and audacious, all at once.
sentences.chinese: 这是适度而大胆的行动，一锤定音。

sentences.english: Whatever decision you make now is set in stone.
sentences.chinese: 您现在做的任何决定都是一锤定音的。

sentences.english: And when you get an answer, you can be sure that it is the final answer.
sentences.chinese: 而您得到的回复一定就是一锤定音的答案。

sentences.english: But we have yet to find the magic bullet.
sentences.chinese: 但我们仍然有待找到那颗一锤定音的魔弹。

sentences.english: And their decision is final. Except for court.
sentences.chinese: 他们的决定除法院外，是一锤定音的。

sentences.english: "Is old too gentleman one pummel bench a sound, " comes to a decision so.
sentences.chinese: 老太君一锤定音，“就这么决定了。

definition: to call the tune/to make the final decision
clapper-board/auctioneer's hammer/to beat time with clappers
don't pass judgment on a person's life until the lid is on the coffin (idiom)
to gain the upper hand by a show of strength
victory or defeat/the outcome of a battle
lit. to upend heaven and earth (idiom)/fig. to change the course of events/to turn things around
unexpected (idiom)/surprising
to be unwilling to pass on one's responsibilities to others
win or lose, it all ends here/this is the moment to shine
pinyin: cheng2 bai4 zai4 ci3 yi1 ju3

definition: to try to score (a goal)/final push (at a critical juncture)/the final leg of sth
to set out (on a campaign)/to stand for election/to throw one's cap in the ring
first round (of match, or election)
decisive/conclusive
to determine victory/to obtain victory
"Red Poppies", novel by 阿來|阿来[A1 lai2]
lit. the dust has settled (idiom)/fig. to get sorted out/to be finalized
to hit the mark with a comment (idiom)/to say sth spot on
